concerns.description: Constant screen capture and activity tracking are a severe invasion of employee privacy.
The system promotes micromanagement, eroding trust and autonomy.
Constant monitoring and productivity scoring will likely increase employee stress and anxiety.
The system focuses on quantity over quality, potentially leading to a distorted view of employee performance.
Captured data, including potentially personal information, could be vulnerable to breaches or misuse.

impact_score.reasoning: This proposal introduces a highly invasive monitoring system that significantly reduces employee autonomy and increases stress. While it aims to improve productivity, the methods used are likely to create a toxic work environment and fail to accurately measure true performance. The justification provided seems to overstate the benefits while downplaying the potential negative impacts on employee well-being and morale.
